entry.title: Just Flight Releases Piper PA-28R Arrow III for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. In partnership with Thranda Design, Just Flight has developed a rendition of the Piper PA-28R for X-Plane 12, featuring a highly detailed simulation of the popular four-seater first introduced in 1976. As the name suggests, the PA-28R Arrow III is the third iteration of the Piper Arrow lineup. It was launched in 1967 with the PA-28R-180, followed by the Arrow II. Five years later, it was majorly upgraded with a semi-tapered wing, larger fuel tanks (meaning increased range), and several other improvements and commercialized under the Arrow III moniker. The add-on features high-quality 8K texturing throughout, reworked PBR materials, a brand new EFB tablet with aircraft configuration states, checklists, and customization options, a dynamic livery feature with color, design, and dirt level change on the fly, a high-quality FMOD sound set, and much more.Â Itâs available on Just Flightâs website for roughly $42.99, requiring at least 2.5 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: TFDi Releases MD-11 for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. TFDi has recently released their rendition of the passenger and cargo variants of the McDonnell Douglas MD-11 for Microsoft Flight Simulator (and Prepar3d), an ETOPS-capable trijet introduced in 1990 and still in use by many cargo airlines around the World.Â The original idea behind the MD-11 development was to take the DC-10 as a baseline and modernize it with the latest and greatest in technology from the early 90s, albeit without going overboard given McDonnellâs financial situation, which led to suboptimal fuel efficiency in comparison with the soon-to-be rivals at the time (Airbus A330/A340, Boeing 777), but with greater maximum range, even if briefly (which made it a relatively short-lived airplane, with only 200 units built).Â The timing couldnât have been worse for a brand-new trijet, as airlines were already prioritizing fuel-efficient twin-engine airplanes and slowly phasing out their fuel-guzzling three, four-engine jets. Unsurprisingly enough, the MD-11 didnât take off in orders. TFDIâs rendition brings the General Electric engines (Pratt & Whitney option to come later), with custom modeled systems, a custom-built flight management computer, high-resolution texturing, high-detail cabins (pax and cargo), and an onboard EFB allowing you to control payload and change specific settings.Â Their âa la carteâ pricing model allows you to pick only the variant(s) you want: both cost $69.99 (cargo or passenger), and the other variant can be obtained for an extra $9.99, making it $80 for both. An â extended simulation packageâ is set to be released in late 2024, adding failures and circuit breakers. The base packages can be found on TFDiâs website. Shout out to SCOTSGOD for the screenshots! Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Microsoft Releases Local Legend 17: Curtiss C-46 Commando for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Microsoft recently released the Curtiss C-46 Commando for Microsoft Flight Simulator, the latest Local Legend at number 17. The aircraft has been impressively developed for the simulator. The C-46 Commando is an American twin-engine aircraft built for military transport. The airplane was manufactured by the company Curtiss-Wright. It had its first flight in 1940 and entered service in 1941 with the United States Army Air Forces. Throughout its lifespan, the aircraft has been used for various purposes including freight operations, medical evacuation, and glider towing. entry.title: MXI Design Releases Karpathos Airport for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. MXI Design recently released its version of Karpathos Airport (LGKP) for Microsoft Flight Simulator. Located on the Greek island of Karpathos, the airport serves approximately 270.000 passengers annually, who are seeking sun and fun in the Greek islands. Karpathos Airport opened in 1970 as a small airport with limited facilities. Initially, it had only a 500 square meter building. Construction for new airport facilities began in 2005, and the new airport terminal was completed in 2009. The new airport buildings covers a total of 12.500 square meters, a significant increase from the original 500. Today, the airport is a crucial hub for the island, connecting it with destinations both within the country and around the world. The airport serves a variety of seasonal and year-round destinations, including Athens, Amsterdam, Rome, and more, welcoming around 270.000 passengers annually. The scenery package includes accurately modeled terminal and airport buildings, up-to-date ground layouts, PBR implementation, custom CGL aerial imagery, a detailed handmade terrain model, and more. The newly released Karpathos Airport requires 1.81 GB of storage space, and it is available on both SimMarket and Orbx for approximately $10.76. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: Boundless Releases Glasgow Prestwick Airport for X-Plane 11 & 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Boundless has recently launched its latest scenery for both X-Plane 11 and X-Plane 12. This time, they have introduced Glasgow Prestwick Airport (EGPK) for the flight simulator. Situated in Prestwick, Scotland, this international airport serves as a focus city for the airline Ryanair. Glasgow Prestwick Airport has been in operation as an airport since 1935. In 1938, passenger facilities were added to the airport. Over the years, the airport has seen commercial growth, resulting in various facility improvements. It has also served military purposes, with the RAF controlling transatlantic flights during World War II. Today, Ryanair operates the majority of flights from the airport, traveling to destinations like Alicante, Barcelona, and Malaga. Additionally, the airport hosts cargo operations for airlines such as Air France Cargo and Cargolux. Last year, the airport served 525,000 passengers, making it the fifth busiest airport in Scotland. It is also worth noting that Glasgow Prestwick Airport is the largest airport in Scotland in terms of land area. The recently released scenery includes a range of features such as up-to-date HD ortho imagery, 4K PBR terminal and airport buildings, 3D volumetric grass, HD custom clutter objects, realistic GSE, and much more. The recently released Glasgow Prestwick Airport scenery requires 2.6 GB of storage space, and is available on Boundless for approximately $24.24. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: Veco Simulations Releases Trailer for T-38A
entry.summary: Sim: DCS. Veco Simulations have recently released the trailer for their first community mod for DCS - T-38A Talon.Â T-38 Talon is a two-seat, twinjet supersonic jet trainer produced by Northrop Corporation between 1961 and 1972. It was the first supersonic jet trainer, as well as the most produced jet trainer. After more than 63 years since its introduction, it has trained over 72,000 pilots in USAF and other NATO nations air forces, during the joint-training programs. Due to SDK limitations, the development group decided to focus on the 1970s avionic configuration, which will allow them to add every functionality, without the need for other modules or sacrificing fidelity. The mentioned configuration features a functional UHF radio, intercom for communication between pilot and instructor in the back seat, TACAN, ILS, and a mechanical Flight Director system. Veco Simulationsâ rendition of T-38 will be released as a free standalone, full-fidelity, community mod. The trailer provided us with amazing shots of the aircraft's exterior and short sneak peeks of the untextured model of the cockpit.Â Currently, we have no feature list as of now, but we do however have an estimated release date! At the very end of the trailer, we could see 2025, which could be the possible release year. As of now, no more information about the release date has been released, however, as always, Threshold will keep you updated!Â â Stay tuned to Threshold for flight sim news!

entry.title: Parallel 42âs 777 Immersion Releasing on Friday
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Parallel 42 has recently announced a release date for their upcoming 777 Immersion package for Microsoft Flight Simulator - part of their SimFX add-on - aiming to improve the overall realism of the effects within the simulator, including condensation, new particle effects, and more. Available as a single package for all major renditions of the triple seven airframe regardless of the livery used, bringing immersive effects for the PMDG and CaptainSim (at a later date) and customized for each with performance as their top priority.Â Built on the SimFx framework, it offers the best combination of effects and customizability via the SimFx interface. For the unaware, Parallel 42âs SimFX is a visual effects utility covering a range of immersive scenarios. Every particle on the screen is authentically governed by environmental variables and formulas, and dynamic effects appear under the right conditions, creating unique moments in the virtual skies. The effects include contrails, heat blurs, wing wash, rotor wash, and more. Their immersion package for the 777 builds on top of what SimFx already offers, bringing nineteen custom effects for the mighty triple seven, including swirling contrails, condensation effects, waste water drain every hour, engine cold start effects, fuel jettison, cloud illumination, hot brakes smoke, carbon brake dust, and water droplets. The APU heat blur and the St. Elmoâs fire are not supported because of a development choice by PMDG, using a deprecated technique preventing SimFX or 777 Immersion from injecting their version of those effects. The package will be available for $15.00 on Friday (July 12).
